message_1: Given the statement "I know that it is sunny today", translate it into epistemic logic using the operator K and determine if it is true or false that "I do not know if it is sunny today".
message_2:
In epistemic logic, the operator K represents knowledge. The statement "I know that it is sunny today" can be translated into epistemic logic as:

K(sunny)

Now, we want to determine if the statement "I do not know if it is sunny today" is true or false. This statement can be translated into epistemic logic as:

¬K(sunny)

Since the given statement is "I know that it is sunny today" (K(sunny)), the statement "I do not know if it is sunny today" (¬K(sunny)) is false.
